bibl.title: Letter from Edgar Mayer to Philip Showalter Hench, January 25, 1943

div1.p: Mayer invites Hench to serve on the Medical Advisory Board. He wants to support the memorial in Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Edgar Mayer to Philip Showalter Hench, January 25, 1943
div1.opener:
DR. EDGAR MAYER
FOUR SEVENTY PARK AVENUE
NEW YORK
----
TELEPHONE PLAZA 3-5406-9
January 25, 1943.
Col. Philip Hench
Camp Carson
Colorado Springs, Colorado.
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
I met with Fishbein yesterday after he
met with Basil O'Connor. We have some important
prospects in view for the Finlay Institute which
will be announced shortly. It will relate to post-
war medical set-up. Morris and I will be anxious to
have you serve on the Medical Advisory Board of the
Institute. As you know we are now incorporated.

I told Morris about our desires in relation
to the Memorial in Cuba and he is likewise enthusiastic
and I think if you come on at a date set around February
13th, we can go into all the details. Morris is going
to try to arrange for your furlough and will let you
know. He is writing you personally. I though I would
write you this immediately so you understood what it
was all about when he did communicate with you.
I am looking forward to seeing you here.
